intro: Juncoides lactea, commonly known as the milkweed juncea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Juncaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are clustered in spike-like inflorescences. Juncoides lactea is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
